meanings.definition: A photographic reproduction of a printed page or illustration.
meanings.sent1: I saw a phototype of a beautiful painting in the art book.
meanings.sent2: The museum displayed various phototypes of famous artworks.
meanings.sent3: The phototype of the Mona Lisa looked like a funny cartoon version.
meanings.sent4: Her smile was a phototype of pure joy captured in a photograph.
meanings.sent5: The phototype of the sunset was so vivid, it felt like I was there.

meanings.definition: To produce a photographic reproduction of a printed page or illustration.
meanings.sent1: The artist will phototype the sketch to create multiple copies.
meanings.sent2: She learned how to phototype images for the magazine layout.
meanings.sent3: I phototype my cat's picture and it looks like a tiny model!
meanings.sent4: His memories phototype in his mind like old photographs.
meanings.sent5: The camera can phototype the scene with incredible detail.
